docs.lead_paragraph: Workers’ wages continued dropping, but corporate profits soared to a record high in the third quarter.

headline.seo: For Companies, the Good Old Days Are Now
headline.main: For Business, Golden Days; For Workers, the Dross
headline.print_headline: For Business, Golden Days; For Workers, The Dross

docs.abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column notes corporate profits after taxes hit record high of $1.56 trillion, at annual rate, during third quarter, or 10.3 percent of gross domestic product; points out, however, that wage and salary income was record low of 43.7 percent of GDP.
docs.snippet: Workers’ wages continued dropping, but corporate profits soared to a record high in the third quarter.

docs.lead_paragraph: Companies’ compensation budgets remain tight, so workers need to gather information before approaching the boss.

headline.seo: How to Make the Case for Higher Pay
headline.main: How to Make the Case for Higher Pay
headline.print_headline: How to Make the Case For Higher Pay

docs.abstract: Tara Siegel Bernard Your Money column discusses points to consider before asking for a raise at work.
docs.snippet: Companies’ compensation budgets remain tight, so workers need to gather information before approaching the boss.

headline.main: The Supreme Court and Health Care

docs.abstract: President Obama has not made the strongest arguments possible for his health insurance law, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: President Obama has not made the strongest arguments possible for his health insurance law, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 100 Texas doctors, researchers and medical experts who are paid with taxpayer dollars routinely supplement their salaries with income from pharmaceutical companies.

headline.print_headline: Payments to Doctors by Pharmaceutical Companies Raise Issues of Conflicts

docs.lead_paragraph: Thanks to the deficit panel, paying beneficiaries money to buy private coverage has gained bipartisan backing.

headline.seo: Support Builds for Premium Support Plan for Medicare
headline.main: Support Builds for a Plan to Rein In Medicare Costs
headline.print_headline: Support Builds for a Plan To Rein In Medicare Costs

docs.abstract: Lawmakers and health policy experts say that the special Congressional committee on deficit reduction built a case for major structural changes in Medicare that would limit the government's open-ended financial commitment to the program, even though it never reached an agreement; the committee's work has slowly been gaining the support of members from both parties, and will probably frame the debate on the future of the program.
docs.snippet: Thanks to the deficit panel, paying beneficiaries money to buy private coverage has gained bipartisan backing.

keywords.value: Joint Select Committee on Deficit Reduction
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House should not wobble on requiring free contraceptive coverage in health insurance plans.
docs.abstract: Editorial urges the White House to resist calls from Roman Catholic and other religious leaders to alter new rules that include contraceptives for women in the package of preventive health care services that all insurers must cover without a deductible or co-payment beginning in 2012; holds that plan will drive down rates of unintended pregnancy and abortion.
docs.snippet: The White House should not wobble on requiring free contraceptive coverage in health insurance plans.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Europeans save more than we do. What can we learn from them?

headline.main: Why We Spend, Why They Save
headline.print_headline: Why We Spend, Why They Save

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Professor Sheldon Garon compares saving habits of Europeans and Americans and suggests there is much this nation of spenders can learn from its thriftier overseas counterparts; concedes that saving is difficult in a consumer economy that does not value individual prudence.
docs.snippet: Europeans save more than we do. What can we learn from them?

headline.main: An Electronic Eye on Hospital Hand-Washing

docs.abstract: A video monitoring system is helping to increase hand-washing rates and reduce deadly hospital-acquired infections.
docs.snippet: A video monitoring system is helping to increase hand-washing rates and reduce deadly hospital-acquired infections.

docs.lead_paragraph: Beeps and blinking lights are the constant chatter of a hospital intensive care unit, but at the I.C.U.'s in North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset, N.Y., the conversation has some unusual contributors.  Two L.E.D. displays adorn the wall across from each nurses' station.  They show the hand hygiene rate achieved:  last Friday in the surgical I.C.U., the weekly rate was 85 percent and the current shift had a rate of 91 percent.  "Great Shift!!" the sign said.   At the medical I.C.U. next door, the weekly rate was 81 percent, and the current shift 82 percent.

headline.main: An Electronic Eye on Hospital Hand-Washing

docs.abstract: A video monitoring system is helping to increase hand-washing rates and reduce deadly hospital-acquired infections.
docs.snippet: A video monitoring system is helping to increase hand-washing rates and reduce deadly hospital-acquired infections.

docs.lead_paragraph: G.O.P. rivals pounced after Newt Gingrich spoke at the most recent debate of a “humane” immigration policy that would limit deportations.

headline.seo: Newt Gingrich’s Words on Immigration Become a Target
headline.main: Gingrich’s Words on Immigration Become a Target
headline.print_headline: Gingrich’s Words on Immigration Become a Target

docs.abstract: Republican presidential hopefuls debating in Iowa eagerly attack Newt Gingrich, who is rising in the polls, for his calls for a humane immigration policy that would limit deportations; chart shows each candidates' stance on immigration.
docs.snippet: G.O.P. rivals pounced after Newt Gingrich spoke at the most recent debate of a “humane” immigration policy that would limit deportations.
